lead_paragraph: Seeking to draw a contrast with Dilma Rousseff, the suspended leftist president, Mr. Temer said he would try to repeal nationalist oil legislation, curb spending and shut down a sovereign wealth fund.

headline.print_headline: Brazil’s New Leader Aims to Restore Faith in Economy
headline.main: Michel Temer Aims to Restore Confidence in Brazil’s Economy

snippet: Seeking to draw a contrast with Dilma Rousseff, the suspended leftist president, Mr. Temer said he would try to repeal nationalist oil legislation, curb spending and shut down a sovereign wealth fund.
abstract: Brazil's interim Pres Michel Temer outlines several proposals aimed at restoring confidence in country's ailing economy and at distancing himself from ousted leader Dilma Rousseff.
